required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Radiological Study of HRCT to Predict Pathological Noninvasiveness in NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Radiological Study of HRCT to Predict Pathological Noninvasiveness in NSCLC

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the correlation between radiological diagnosis based on HRCT and pathological invasiveness. All enrolled patients receive HRCT examination before surgery. Investigators observe the radiological features and the correlation with the postoperative pathological findings.

detailed_description.textblock: Radiological findings determines the decision-making about the extent of primary surgical resection in adenocarcinoma of lung. Previous study showed the diagnosis of AIS/MIA and IAD based on radiological findings is correlated to the pathological diagnose. The purpose of this analysis is to define the role of radiological diagnosis.

primary_outcome.description: The specificity and Sensitivity based on the radiological diagnosis.

secondary_outcome.description: the number of patients with radiological invasiveness diagnosis / total number of patients

arm_group.description: Patients with lung cancer who are candidates for surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- pulmonary nodule diagnosed by thoracic CT
- karnofsky performance status ≥60
- No surgical contraindication
- Patients who sign the informed consent
- Pre-operation clinical stage :T1abcN0M0
Exclusion Criteria:
- Central lung tumor diagnosed by CT
- Tracheal or bronchus deformity diagnosed by CT
- Tracheal or bronchus disease history
- Severe smoking history #smoking index ≥400/year

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Department of thoracic surgery and multidisciplinary group of thoracic oncology
